algorithm_technique: Count mismatches of type 'xy' and 'yx', then use greedy swaps.
problem_summary_simple: Find the minimum swaps between two strings to make them identical, using only 'x' and 'y'.
problem_summary_technical: Count 'xy' and 'yx' mismatches. Two 'xy' or two 'yx' need one swap. One 'xy' and one 'yx' need two swaps. Impossible if mismatch counts have different parity.
key_insights: The core idea is to identify pairs of differing characters ('xy' and 'yx').
Two 'xy' mismatches can be resolved with one swap (swap s1[i] with s2[j] where s1[i]='x', s2[j]='y').
One 'xy' and one 'yx' mismatch require two swaps to resolve.
